resources.name: Asheville Housing Authority
resources.description: The Housing Authority of the City of Asheville strives to serve its residents by providing an affordable home and avenues to self-sufficiency.

resources.name: FIRST at Blue Ridge, Inc
resources.description: FIRST at Blue Ridge is a State of North Carolina licensed Residential Therapeutic Community for men and women with chronic substance use disorders. The programâ€™s mission is to provide opportunity and guidance to those with addictions and assist them to make positive life changes in order to become responsible and productive members of society. The program includes classes, recovery meetings, individual and/or group therapy sessions, and job search assistance.

resources.name: Biltmore Housing, Inc.
resources.description: Biltmore Housing provides recovery-oriented supportive housing in Asheville, Arden and Hendersonville.

resources.name: Homeward Bound of WNC
resources.description: Homeward Bound of WNC provide assistance to the homeless regardless of criminal history or income.

resources.name: North Carolina Coalition to End Homelessness
resources.description: NCCEH works with communities to address root causes of homelessness by developing and implementing data-driven strategies that are focused on permanent housing and appropriate services.

resources.name: Women in Transition Program
resources.description: The Women in Transition Program of the YWCA Central Carolinas provides safe housing for single, unaccompanied women.

resources.name: NC LINKS
resources.description: NC LINKS is a program for young adults with previous engagement in the foster care program.

resources.name: SocialServe.com
resources.description: Socialserve.com is a free housing locator service that covers most areas in North Carolina.
